subject: Pedal Product support
description_text:
Hello, I contacted simsonn through Amazon and was told to send a video
here. I am seeking product support for pro x pedals I purchased a little
under a year ago. When I originally wrote through Amazon it was just the
clutch. The throttle just went out as well as I was about to use it and if
you wantch the videos it seems the brake may not be quite functioning
properly either. The throttle and brake were fine this morning. The
throttle was intermittent and very jumpy at first and then went out
completely. I've loved them otherwise but don't feel they should be dying
in less then a year of casual use. See videos. Thank you!

1000010731.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/12rQZs0K70Orl_2xD3N9c3XzmqVndmyF5/view?usp=drivesdk>

1000010733.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KlSE0wwsv0lxZkrCbDyLyL7ygt2wRQWq/view?usp=drivesdk>


Paul Burbank
Blue Sky Electrical Services, LLC
727-275-0767
518-226-2024

Is anyone reading these?

Hi Paul Burbank,     If your current version is 1.7.1, you can manually update the firmware to support Simsonn Manager 2.1.2.  Please follow this path:  Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-plus.sfu

Hello. Thanks for the response. I've already done this. I'm almost positive the load cells in the throttle and clutch are defective. It could be the control box. However, when plugging the throttle or clutch into the brake port I still have no response from either but I do have response from the brake when plugging it into the clutch and/or throttle ports.

Have you read the whole ticket? The problem is not software related. I was having a seperate software issue that started after I submitted the original ticket but I have since corrected that issue. This is a hardware problem.

I have loved this pedal set and I have recommended these pedals to other sim racers at least a dozen times. I was considering purchasing a wheel too. But if they won't even last a year under normal use and simsonn won't stand behind their product I'll just pay the price for something more expensive from a more reputable company. I'm very frustrated by this whole thing and by the lack of response from support so far.

Hi Paul Burbank,    This issue may be caused by an incorrect configuration of the control box. If you are currently using version 1.7.1, updating with the latest software can usually resolve the problem quickly.
I have already updated the software. Please look at the picture in my post from 3 days ago and see that it says V 2.1.2

Hi Paul Burbank,    I have reviewed the entire email thread and noticed that you have not yet downloaded Simsonn Manager 2.1.2.  You are currently using SimConfigPedals V4, which is the previous-generation calibration software.
I do not know how you can have deduced that. But I will go through steps you would like me to. I will get back to you shortly.
Hi Paul Burbank,    This is because the new calibration software uses this updated UI interface.

I understand now what you were talking about. However, I have done that as well. Please this newly attached video showing no input from the pedals or clutch and input only from the brake. It won't let me attach a video, it says it's too big. I will try submitting it via email. Here's a screenshot that at least shows the other software.

See attached video

Paul Burbank
Blue Sky Electrical Services, LLC
727-275-0767
518-226-2024

On Sun, Dec 21, 2025, 8:19 AM service@simsonn.com 
Attachment(s) that exceed the 20 MB limit have been dropped. Please reach out to the sender.
It does not look like the video came through on the email either.

Hi Paul Burbank,    In theory, it is unlikely that both the throttle and clutch sensors would fail at the same time. Please upload the test video to Google Drive and grant access so I can review it. If the issue is confirmed to be a hardware failure, we will arrange a replacement sensor for you.

I agree with your logic but that does not mean that is not what is happening. Also, just for your information, they did not both go out at the same time. The clutch has been dead for several weeks. I just hadn't gotten around to submitting a support ticket because I do not use the clutch very often. The throttle died a few days ago, of course, I can't race without it, so I submitted a ticket right away. Please see the attached Google drive link. This does not show me operating the pedals with my feet because I have to reattach the throttle to the base plate in order to do so but if you are insistent I will do that as well. Video
You can here me operating the pedals with my hands but if I MUST reinstall the throttle and show the screen and pedals together I will.

Hi Paul Burbank,    Please provide your order number, contact name, phone number, and shipping address. I will arrange to send you two 20 kg load cell sensors with connectors tomorrow (Monday). Replacing them should restore normal operation of both the throttle and clutch pedals.

Thank you very much! Can you please tell me where these will ship from? I'm just trying to gauge how long I can estimate shipping to take.     Amazon Order # 113-3825241-4645018  Paul Burbank   518-226-2024  8168 Flame Vine Ave   Seminole FL, 33777
Hi Paul Burbank,    These spare parts are usually shipped directly from China.

Thank you...just throwing this out there and am totally fine with you sending the spare parts if you prefer. I don't know how much you will spend on load cells and on shipping. But I would be more then happy to accept a discount code(in an amount we both agree on) or something like that to just order new pedals with domestic shipping as opposed to have you send load cells from China that will probably take weeks to arrive. If this is not an amicable solution for you that is fine as well. Just a suggestion.
Hi Paul Burbank,  Please let me know which pedal you would like to purchase and the discount you are hoping for, so that we can arrange it for you.

Good morning. I'm glad you are open to an alternative solution. I paid $282 when I purchased the set I have now anything less then 50% of that original purchase price and I would rather you just send the replacement parts honestly. That said, if I'm investing money I want to upgrade to your newest offering and would probably want to do the haptics as well. Not sure if you can do a code I can use on your site for a dollar amount or if you need me to be more specific on the exact product so the code only applies to the item I'm interested in or even if you need to place the order on your end for some reason. To simplify things 50% off the pro X ultra w/haptics(3 pedals but don't care about clutch haptics)would be amazing but a total discount of $140(50% of my original purchase price) would be perfectly acceptable as well.
Good morning. Any word on how simsonn prefers to go about this? Thank you!

I just want to be able to use my pedals again. I thought my suggestion might be a good solution. I have know clue how much it will cost you in materials and shipping to send me me new load cells and I know they will probably take a long time to ship from cchuna so I thought maybe this would get a fix sooner on my end. If this solution doesn't work for simsonn that's fine but could you then please go ahead and send the load cells if that is the case?
Hello?

Hi Paul Burbank,   I am sorry for the late response.     Please follow the steps below:     Press and hold the upgrade button on the PlusX main controller, then reconnect the USB cable.     Open SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 and check if it has entered recovery mode.     If recovery mode is detected, go to Settings → Update → Manual Update Firmware → pedals → firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu.     After the update is complete, test the device to see if it has been restored successfully.

Is this a new representative? We've already gone through all of this. Please see the previous messages. I'm currently waiting for a discount code for your website or for simsonn to ship new load cells

I would really appreciate you guys expediting the process on making this right. Between chatting here and through Amazon this has been going on for weeks now. I just want to use my sim. I'm about ready to buy a set of pedals from a different manufacturer to be completely honest. Which is a shame because until now I've loved the product. Being dead for weeks on a product less then a year old and STILL not knowing if, how, or when it will be rectified is not something I'm interested in dealing with in the future. I don't even have a reset or upgrade button on my control box. I've updated the software more then once. I've tried the brake pedal in the throttle and cable ports. The load cells are bad. Please expedite sending now load cells or giving me a generous discount code to purchase a new set with domestic shipping. Simsonn has a 2yr warranty do they not? Please make this right ASAP
Hi Paul Burbank,  Could you please provide your order number and your shipping address? I will contact Amazon customer service to handle this for you.

Here is the requested information, which I have previously provided 8 days ago. However, please note, I contacted through Amazon first and they told me to contact you here.     Amazon Order # 113-3825241-4645018  Paul Burbank   518-226-2024  8168 Flame Vine Ave   Seminole FL, 33777
Hi Paul Burbank,  GOT IT.
Does that mean you are sending replacement load cells? If so is it possible to provide tracking information once they ship?

I don't understand why this has to be such a hassle....I just want to use my pedals. I've been dealing with this for weeks at this point. Tell me what I need for load cells and I'll buy the damn things myself if I have to. I know they're dirt cheap.
